agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that provides guardianship intervention services for elders who are actively being exploited financially, abused, or neglected, and for those at imminent risk of being so.
service_description: Serves as the guardian for an incapacitated adult. A volunteer then maintains regular contact with the incapacitated adult, directs their health care, attends and/or participates in care plan conferences to ensure health care services are appropriate and that the services maximize the incapacitated person's quality of life.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Incapacitated adults , age 18 or older -- Hospitalized patients -- Nursing home patients -- Outpatients and end-of-life patients in crisis -- Physician's report stating care required due to mental or medical incapacity -- No suitable or willing relative or other significant person to serve as guardian -- Madison County Probate Court determined a guardian is needed

agency_desc: Provides law enforcement, crime investigation, crime prevention, emergency assistance, and other police duties for the town of Ingalls in Madison County.
service_description: Provides law enforcement, crime investigation, crime prevention, emergency assistance, and other police duties for the town of Ingalls in Madison County.
site_details: Call 9-1-1 for emergency police assistance. For nonemergency services, call the office during business hours or call Madison County dispatch after hours.
site_eligibility: Open; Serves the town of Ingalls in Madison County.

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization working to build stronger communities through child abuse prevention, home-based services, youth placement, and recovery services.
service_name: COMMUNITY PARTNERS FOR CHILD SAFETY (CPCS) - REGION 11
service_description: Provides a home-based child abuse and neglect prevention program to Hamilton, Hancock, Madison, and Tipton County families with children. Services are tailored to meet each individual family's needs and may include case management, advocacy, parent education, and referrals to community resources.
site_details: Call for information; no referral necessary. -- A case manager will come to the home to conduct initial assessment.
site_eligibility: Families with children ages 0-17 -- Experiencing challenges (behavioral, financial, or other source of instability) -- Not actively involved with the Department of Child Services (DCS) / Child Protective Services (CPS), or the Healthy Families program -- If a family has a youth with an open juvenile probation case and the youth is in an out of home placement, the family may receive services as long as they have other children living in the home.

agency_desc: A commercial organization providing an inpatient substance use treatment facility for men.
service_description: Provides an inpatient treatment program for men. Services include substance use treatment, mental healthcare, Medication-Assisted Treatment (MAT), peer support groups, and education and skills training.
taxonomy_name: Inpatient Substance Use Disorder Treatment Facilities
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
nameLevel4: Inpatient Substance Use Disorder Treatment Facilities
site_details: Visit website or call for information. -- Visit website to start and online application; agency will contact to schedule an admission interview.
site_eligibility: Men -- Age 18 or older -- Individuals seeking inpatient residential treatment for drug or alcohol use -- Submit to frequent, random drug and alcohol screening -- Mentally and physically able to participate in program -- Agree to follow rules and guidelines -- Willing to participate in recovery -- Primary issue must be substance abuse or dependency -- Provide release documentation if coming from hospital or detox facility -- Able to pay for all program fees and/or actively seeking insurance and state residential fee coverage -- Medically detoxed prior to arrival

agency_desc: We hope to provide a warm, safe, multipurpose center that promotes and provides quality activities and services that will contribute to the emotional, moral, and social well-being of the community.
service_description: Provides perishable and nonperishable food items to those in need.
site_details: Walk in.
site_eligibility: Living in Fairmount, Summitville, or Northern Alexandria -- Limit one visit per month

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that provides information and advocacy to those who have experienced domestic violence, human trafficking, prostitution, or sexual exploitation.
service_description: Provides information, education, and advocacy for women who are current or previous victims of domestic violence, human trafficking, prostitution, or sexual exploitation. Guidance and support services are provided to restore confidence, self worth, and love. Referrals to community resources are offered to empower women in transition of a new life path.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Walk in or call for information.
site_eligibility: Women -- Recovering from violence, exploitation, sex trafficking or sexual exploitation

agency_desc: A community action agency that designs, sponsors, and administers programs that provide help for today and hope for tomorrow.
site_name: CENTRAL INDIANA COMMUNITY ACTION PROGRAM - MADISON COUNTY
service_description: Serves as an application and re-certification site for the Section 8 Housing Choice Voucher program in Madison County. Housing Choice Vouchers help eligible households pay the rent on privately owned homes of their choosing (property owners must agree to program participation). The wait list for Housing Choice Vouchers in this area is currently CLOSED. People already on the wait list must keep their contact information current to remain on the list.
site_details: Application process is currently CLOSED. Local media will announce when the wait list opens. -- People already on the wait list, call to update contact information as needed.
site_eligibility: When the wait list is open, income guidelines will be posted. Preference is given to seniors, persons with disabilities, and working families.

agency_desc: An incorporated nonprofit agency which "strives to eradicate domestic and sexual violence through education, prevention, and intervention in Central Indiana." Alternatives Inc. supports survivors through the initial crisis with the ultimate strategy of helping them achieve abuse-free and financially independent lives.
service_description: Provides emergency housing and supportive services for survivors of domestic violence, sexual assault, or human trafficking (and dependents) experiencing crisis and in need of immediate assistance. Services for this short-term program include meals, case management, and advocacy. Crisis line available 24 hours per day.
site_details: Call for assistance.
site_eligibility: Survivors of domestic violence, sexual assault, or human trafficking with or without dependents living in Hamilton, Hancock, Henry, Madison, Marion, and Tipton Counties

agency_desc: An incorporated nonprofit agency which "strives to eradicate domestic and sexual violence through education, prevention, and intervention in Central Indiana." Alternatives Inc. supports survivors through the initial crisis with the ultimate strategy of helping them achieve abuse-free and financially independent lives.
service_description: Provides assistance and crisis response to survivors of domestic violence, sexual assault, and human trafficking. Services include court accompaniment, assistance filing a protective order, advocacy, and case management. Can assist with arranging emergency transportation from Madison County to the shelter in Anderson for survivors and their dependents who have been accepted into the shelter.
site_details: For immediate assistance call the crisis hotline. For all other inquiries call, email, visit website, or Facebook page for assistance. www.alternativesdv.org / www.facebook.com/AlternativesIncDV
site_eligibility: Survivors of domestic violence, sexual assault, or human trafficking with or without dependents living or working in Madison County

agency_desc: A multi-state nonprofit organization bringing human services to people and communities in eleven states.
service_description: Provides a public preschool program combining education, nutrition, health, and social services for children from low-income families. Income guidelines may be waived for children with special needs or disabilities. The program is delivered on a school-year basis at several locations. Transportation is provided within set boundaries.
site_details: Call or visit the website for enrollment information and locations.
site_eligibility: Ages 3-5 years (Age 3 by August 1st) -- At or below 100% Federal Poverty Level -OR- Children who are: in low-income households, in foster care, homeless, and/or from families receiving public assistance (TANF or SSI). -- Note: Other special circumstances (such as disabilities) may be considered.

agency_desc: A multi-state nonprofit organization bringing human services to people and communities in eleven states.
service_description: Provides prenatal and early childhood support through a home-based program that combines parenting education, economic self-sufficiency planning, and health and social services for low-income families.
site_details: Call or visit the website for enrollment information and locations.
site_eligibility: Pregnant women and mothers with children up to age 3 -- At or below 100% Federal Poverty Level -- Children who are: in low-income households, in foster care, homeless, and/or from families receiving public assistance (TANF or SSI). -- Other special circumstances may be considered.

agency_desc: A nonprofit network of hospitals and other health and medical services providing a wide range of diagnostic, treatment, and health care programs, including 24-hour emergency care.
service_description: Offers outpatient treatment for adults and youth experiencing a mental health issue or psychiatric disorder, such as anger management, anxiety, attention deficit/hyperactivity disorder (ADHD), bipolar disorder, depression, post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD), or schizophrenia. Services include an initial assessment as well as individual, group, and/or family counseling. Case management, psychiatric medication services, home-based services, community-based psychiatric rehabilitation, and supported employment services are available to eligible clients receiving treatment from this center.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call Central Intake to schedule an assessment. For crisis intervention, call the Crisis Line.
site_eligibility: Age 5 and older -- In need of outpatient mental health services (based on assessment)

site_eligibility: Open; patients age 18 or younger must be accompanied by a parent or legal guardian

agency_name: BUREAU OF CHILD DEVELOPMENT SERVICES - INDIANA DIVISION OF DISABILITY AND REHABILITATIVE SERVICES
agency_desc: A government agency assuring Indiana families with infants and toddlers experiencing developmental delays or disabilities have access to early intervention services close to home when they need them through a coordinated system of local inter-agency councils called First Steps.
site_name: FIRST STEPS OF EAST CENTRAL INDIANA - CLUSTER H
service_description: Serves as an entry point for infants and toddlers who have or are at risk for developmental delays. Services include home-based special instruction; occupational, physical, and speech therapy; access to health and social services; and case management.
taxonomy_name: Early Intervention for Children With Disabilities/Delays
nameLevel3: Early Intervention for Children With Disabilities/Delays
site_details: Call for information or to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Living in Blackford, Delaware, Henry, Jay, Madison, Randolph or Wayne County -- Ages 0-3 -- With, or at risk for, developmental delays

agency_desc: A church with worship services and charitable outreach, including a household goods pantry, community meal, and limited utility expense assistance.
service_description: Provides a free hot meal to those in need. A limited number of take-home food items are also available, based on donations.
site_details: Walk in.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A church with worship services and charitable outreach, including a household goods pantry, community meal, and limited utility expense assistance.
service_description: Provides limited financial assistance with gas and electric bills for persons living in the city of Anderson in Madison County who are facing disconnection. This program does not pay utility deposits or reconnection fees. Assistance limited to twice per year. Does NOT provide rental assistance.
site_details: Walk in. -- Go to door two. -- Clients are seen on a first-come, first-served basis (up to 40 individuals assisted monthly). -- Does NOT provide rental assistance.
site_schedule: Monthly 2nd Wed 8am-10:30am (until all funds are exhausted)
site_eligibility: With pending disconnection notice for gas, electric, or water service; service should not already be disconnected -- Not already received assistance two times in the current year

agency_desc: A church with worship services and charitable outreach, including a household goods pantry, community meal, and limited utility expense assistance.
service_description: Provides limited financial assistance with gas and electric bills for persons living in the city of Anderson in Madison County who are facing disconnection. This program does not pay utility deposits or reconnection fees. Assistance limited to twice per year. Does NOT provide rental assistance.

agency_desc: A nonprofit agency offering a food pantry to persons in need.
service_description: Provides perishable and nonperishable food, including butter and eggs, to people in need. Clients make their own selection from available items on a shopping list. Limited service area.
site_details: Walk in; pantry takes place in the church basement.
site_eligibility: Living in Alexandria, Frankton, Orestos -- Limit 2 visits per month

agency_desc: A faith-based nonprofit organization providing charitable outreach programs to persons in need.
service_description: Provides food monthly to persons in need. Limited service area.
site_details: Walk in the door facing 17th Street.
site_eligibility: Living in Madison County

agency_desc: A faith-based nonprofit agency supported by area churches to help those in need in Madison County.
service_description: A small box of pre-selected items designed to provide a few meals until the next scheduled area pantry is available. Limited service area.
site_details: Call for more information and to make an appointment.
site_eligibility: Living in Madison County -- One visit per year -- Emergency food is only available if no other pantries are open or the family in need lives within local neighborhood and has transportation issues

agency_desc: A faith-based nonprofit agency supported by area churches to help those in need in Madison County.
service_description: Provides food to persons in need. Clients make their own selections from available items, which usually include fresh produce, meat, and dairy. Cleaning products, paper products, and over-the-counter medications are sometimes available. Limited service area.
site_details: Walk in.
site_eligibility: Not received assistance from this pantry within the current month

agency_desc: A faith-based nonprofit agency supported by area churches to help those in need in Madison County.
service_description: Offers donated and gently used clothing, kitchenware, and bedding to eligible Madison County households in need. Personal hygiene items and cleaning supplies are also sometimes available. An appointment is required to receive materials. Limited service area.
site_details: Call for appointment.
site_eligibility: Living in Madison County -- Receiving government assistance (such as SNAP or Medicaid) -OR- With a pending application for government assistance -- ,With household income at or below 150% of the Federal Poverty Level -OR- With an emergency need due to unexpected crisis

agency_desc: A faith-based nonprofit agency supported by area churches to help those in need in Madison County.
service_description: Focuses on long term sustainability, setting short and long-term goals to build financial security. Also, provides limited financial assistance to eligible Madison County households facing financial crisis due to an unexpected and temporary situation. Funding depends on donations and is offered on a case-by-case basis. Assistance is limited and may include help with deposits for rent, rent payments, birth certificate or identification card fees, transportation costs, and medical expenses. Does not provide assistance with utilities. Limited service area.
site_details: Call for assessment and to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Living in Madison County -- With household income at or below 250% of the Federal Poverty Level -- Receiving government assistance (such as SNAP or Medicaid)  -OR- With a pending application for government assistance -- Experiencing a financial crisis due to an unexpected and temporary situation (such as job loss, death/abandonment, domestic abuse, medical emergency, or essential home repair expense)

service_description: Offers diapers to parents in need living in Madison County.
site_details: Walk in.
site_eligibility: Living in Madison County -- Limit one visit per month

agency_desc: A community-based food pantry coordinated through the local government serving Union Township in Madison County.
service_description: Provides perishable and nonperishable food to those in need. MUST live in Union Township.
site_details: Drive through for service.
site_eligibility: Must live in Union Township of Madison County -- Limit two visits per month

agency_desc: Oversees outreach programs for the city of Elwood, including a community center and food pantry.
service_description: Offers limited financial assistance (typically $50 or less) with prescription costs, rent payments, or utility bills to eligible households. The amount of assistance is determined on a case-by-case basis and is dependent on funding.
site_details: Walk in.
site_eligibility: Living in 46036 -- Household income at or below 125% of the Federal Poverty Level -- Already applied for assistance with township trustee

service_description: Provides nonperishable food to those in need. Limited service area.
site_details: Walk in.
site_eligibility: Living in 46036 zip code

agency_desc: A cooperative comprised of local churches that offers a food pantry serving Green, Jackson, and Stony Creek townships of Madison County.
service_description: Provides perishable and nonperishable food to those in need. Clients make their own selection from available items. Limited service area.
site_details: Volunteer will register you in your car. -- Stay in vehicle until told to enter the food pantry. -- Only one (1) family member per household will be allowed in the building.
site_eligibility: Living in Stoney Creek, Jackson or Green Township of Madison County.

agency_desc: A faith-based organization offering a community assistance program, community dining room, and emergency men's shelter.
service_description: Provides an emergency men's shelter with dormitory-style sleeping and meals. Clients may have the option of entering this agency's residential program, an 18 to 24-month long-term housing program.
site_details: Walk in.
site_eligibility: Men (age 18 or older) -- Not on the sex offender registry -- Clean/sober upon intake and agree not to use drugs or alcohol during their stay -- Must be able to walk up stairs

agency_desc: A faith-based organization offering a community assistance program, community dining room, and emergency men's shelter.
service_description: Serves sit-down meals open to all community members in need. No carry-out available.
site_details: Walk in.
site_schedule: Breakfast: Mon-Sat 7:30am -- Lunch: Mon-Sun noon -- Dinner: Mon-Sun 5pm
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A faith-based organization offering a community assistance program, community dining room, and emergency men's shelter.
service_description: Offers vouchers that can be exchanged at the Red Door Vintage and Thrift Store for clothing and small household goods. Proof of public assistance is required. Clients receive a set number of vouchers per family member.
site_details: Walk in to the Christian Center to apply for the Community Assistance Program. -- Vouchers may be redeemed at the Red Door Vintage and Thrift store on Thursdays ONLY (located one block west of the Community Assistance Office).
site_schedule: Voucher Requests: Mon-Thurs 8am-4pm -- Voucher Redemption (at Red Door Vintage): Thurs 9am-3:30pm
site_eligibility: Receiving SNAP (food stamps), Medicaid, Hoosier Healthwise, or Healthy Indiana Plan

agency_desc: A faith-based organization offering a community assistance program, community dining room, and emergency men's shelter.
service_description: Provide essentials such as showers and washing machines for those who are homeless within the community. Vouchers are provided after a successful assessment.
site_details: Call for more information or to schedule an assessment.
site_eligibility: Experiencing homelessness

agency_desc: An elected official responsible for administering the township, including such duties as providing township assistance, burial of the indigent, and maintaining the township budget.
service_description: May be able to assist township residents who are experiencing an unexpected crisis with basic needs, such as:  Essential utilities -- Burial/Cremation expenses -- Housing expense -- Work/Medical transportation -- Food/Clothing -- Necessary medications/medical care assistance is at the discretion of the trustee. Denials can be appealed to the county commissioner; information on appealing is included in the denial letter.
site_details: Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: MUST LIVE IN TOWNSHIP (Visit www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address to discover township.) -- With financial need based on assessment -- Able to provide documentation of income and expenses for all household members

service_description: May be able to assist township residents who are experiencing an unexpected crisis with basic needs, such as:  Essential utilities -- Burial/Cremation expenses -- Housing expense -- Work/Medical transportation -- Food/Clothing -- Necessary medications/medical care assistance is at the discretion of the trustee. Denials can be appealed to the county commissioner; information on appealing is included in the denial letter.

Denials can be appealed to the county commissioner; information on appealing is included in the denial letter.
site_details: Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: MUST LIVE IN TOWNSHIP (Visit www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address to discover township.) -- With financial need based on assessment -- Able to provide documentation of income and expenses for all household members

agency_desc: Represents the state of Indiana in felony and misdemeanor criminal prosecutions, conducts criminal investigations, supervises Grand Jury proceedings, enforces child support orders, conducts juvenile adjudication and prosecution, enforces traffic violations, and provides information and assistance to victims of crime.
service_description: Represents the state of Indiana in all felony and misdemeanor criminal prosecutions resulting from crimes committed in Madison County. The prosecutor's office also conducts criminal investigations, supervises Grand Jury proceedings, enforces child support orders, conducts juvenile adjudication and prosecution, enforces traffic laws, and provides information and assistance to victims of crime.
site_details: Varies; call for details.
site_eligibility: Varies by service

agency_desc: Represents the state of Indiana in felony and misdemeanor criminal prosecutions, conducts criminal investigations, supervises Grand Jury proceedings, enforces child support orders, conducts juvenile adjudication and prosecution, enforces traffic violations, and provides information and assistance to victims of crime.
service_description: Files, modifies, and enforces court-ordered child support cases in Madison County.
site_details: To apply for child support or request child support enforcement or modification, call the prosecutor's office to schedule an appointment -- For payment information, call the Indiana Kids Line.

agency_desc: A public transportation system serving the city of Anderson.

site_eligibility: Unable to use CATS fixed-route bus system due to disability; (certification required)

Regulates drainage and septic systems, public swimming pools, and food service establishments in the county. Investigates reports of sanitation violations, substandard housing conditions, air or water pollution, and safety hazards posed by vacant buildings. Offers information and referrals regarding household health and environmental hazards, such as mold, lead, radon, tap water contamination, mosquitoes, and rodents.

service_description: Coordinates lead poisoning case management for youth living within the County.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Living within the county -- Testing is recommended for any child 6 months through 6 years-old who: Lives in or visits a building constructed before 1978 -Or- lives with someone who works with lead (such as a battery factory, steel smelter, stained glass) -OR- has a sibling or playmate who has been diagnosed with lead poisoning.

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Conducts local health fairs, provides health education services to the public, and maintains the lending library and other information resources for the County.

site_eligibility: Schools, community organizations, and other groups in the County

agency_desc: Provides law enforcement, crime investigation, crime prevention, emergency assistance, and other police duties.
service_description: Provides a 24-hour automated phone message line where callers may leave tips about suspected illegal activity in the Anderson area of Madison County. Tips may be made anonymously or callers may leave their contact information for a return call and possible reward.
site_details: Call and leave information on the voicemail.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: Provides law enforcement, crime investigation, crime prevention, emergency assistance, and other police duties.
service_description: Provides law enforcement, crime investigation, crime prevention, emergency assistance, and other police duties for the city of Anderson in Madison County. Persons in need of emergency police assistance should call 9-1-1.
site_details: Call 9-1-1 for emergency police assistance. For nonemergency services, Call the office during business hours or call the city of Anderson dispatch after hours.
site_eligibility: Open; serves the city of Anderson

agency_desc: Provides law enforcement, crime investigation, crime prevention, emergency assistance, and other police duties.

agency_desc: A nonprofit counseling service for individuals with problems of violence or abusive behavior. Offers an Indiana Coalition Against Domestic Violence Certified Batterers Intervention Program.
service_description: Provides a counseling service for men with problems of violent or abusive behavior, including perpetrators of domestic abuse and/or child abuse. This program is certified by the Indiana Coalition Against Domestic Violence (ICADV).
site_details: Call to schedule orientation. (Persons with a court-order must attend an orientation session to meet court requirements.)
site_schedule: Men's Classes: Wed 6pm; Sat 10am -- Women's Classes: Thurs 10am
site_eligibility: Men and women who use violence in relationships -- Age 18 or older or age 17 or younger with parent/guardian permission

agency_desc: A nonprofit counseling service for individuals with problems of violence or abusive behavior. Offers an Indiana Coalition Against Domestic Violence Certified Batterers Intervention Program.
service_description: Provides classes on recognizing and changing patterns of problematic or abusive behavior for men and women who use violence or other abusive behavior in relationships. Participants may self-refer, be court-ordered, or referred by the Department of Child Services (DCS). This 26-week program is certified by the Indiana Coalition Against Domestic Violence (ICADV). Clients may begin the program at any time.
site_details: Call to schedule orientation. (Persons with a court-order must attend an orientation session to meet court requirements.)
site_eligibility: Men and women who use violence in relationships -- Age 18 or older or age 17 or younger with parent/guardian permission

agency_desc: The County Clerk maintains records of all civil and criminal court activities; administers jury draw, child support collections, and voter registration; issues marriage licenses; and records state tax liens.

Processes payments for child support, foreclosures, court costs, and other judgments. Oversees elections in the county.

service_description: Issues, provides, and maintains marriage licenses issued in the county. No witnesses, blood tests, or waiting period are required to obtain one. Both applicants must appear at the time of application. Marriages must take place within 60 days of the marriage license being issued.
site_details: Walk in. Marriage license forms may be completed in advance online or in the clerk's office.
site_eligibility: Marriage license: Both parties at least age 18 (call or visit website for exceptions) -- At least one applicant from this county -OR- both from out of state -- Certified copies: License must have been issued in this county

agency_desc: The County Clerk maintains records of all civil and criminal court activities; administers jury draw, child support collections, and voter registration; issues marriage licenses; and records state tax liens.
service_description: Serves as a voter registration site and provides information about voting, candidates, absentee voting, and volunteering to work the polls. Oversees county-level elections, candidate filings, and campaign finance.
site_details: Call for information -- Walk in or visit website to register
site_eligibility: Registering to vote: United States citizen -- Age 18 by the day of the next election -- Not currently incarcerated -- To vote: Registered to vote a minimum of 29 days before the election

service_description: Processes court-ordered child support payments in the county and provides records of payment history. Payer and payee must keep their names and addresses current with this office; any changes must be made in writing.
site_details: Payment history print out: Walk in to obtain. -- Update name/address: Walk in or mail changes. -- Payment Information: Visit website or call the Indiana Kids Line.
site_schedule: Clerk's Office: Mon-Fri 8am-4pm -- Indiana Kids Line (Payment Information): Recorded information daily 24 hours; live assistance Mon-Fri 7am-6pm
site_eligibility: Parents ordered by the court to pay or receive child support

agency_desc: A government agency that administers housing assistance programs.
service_description: Provides information on subsidized, income-based rental options that do not require a Section 8 Housing Choice Voucher.
site_details: Call for information.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A government agency that administers housing assistance programs.
service_description: Provides subsidized, income-based rental units to eligible families, seniors, and persons who are elderly or disabled. Applications are currently being accepted on a walk-in basis. Rent amount is equal to 30% of the resident's adjusted gross income.
site_details: Walk in to request an application. -- Applications may be completed in the office or returned by mail.
site_eligibility: Low income -- US citizen -OR- and eligible immigrant

agency_desc: A government agency that administers housing assistance programs.
service_description: Serves as an application and recertification site for the Section 8 Housing Choice Voucher program. Housing Choice Vouchers help eligible households pay the rent on privately owned homes of their choosing (property owners must agree to program participation).
site_details: There may be a wait list for Housing Choice Vouchers. Please call or visit, www.ahain.org, for the most current information.
site_eligibility: US citizen -OR- and eligible immigrant -- Income not exceeding 50% of the median income for the county/metropolitan area (Agency can provide the income limits for the Anderson area and family size.)

agency_desc: A government agency that administers housing assistance programs.

site_details: There may be a wait list for Housing Choice Vouchers. Please call or visit, www.ahain.org, for the most current information.
site_eligibility: US citizen -OR- and eligible immigrant -- Income not exceeding 50% of the median income for the county/metropolitan area (Agency can provide the income limits for the Anderson area and family size.)

service_description: Provides new and gently used clothing to children, ages 0-18. Children can shop twice per year (spring and fall) for a week's wardrobe. Shopping appointments are available July-Feb and April-May. Emergency shopping may be available outside of these time frames.

site_eligibility: Living in Madison County -- Ages 0-18

agency_name: HOUSE OF HOPE OF MADISON COUNTY
agency_desc: A nonprofit agency providing a structured residential program to assist men who are new to recovery from drug and/or alcohol dependence.
site_name: HOUSE OF HOPE OF MADISON COUNTY
service_description: Offers a residential program for men in early recovery from drug or alcohol addiction. A six-week relapse prevention workshop is also available. Residents make a 90-day commitment, attend Alcoholics Anonymous/Narcotics Anonymous meetings and individual counseling, submit to random drug tests, and perform daily chores. Longer-term transitional housing at Blackwell House may be available for those who complete the House of Hope recovery program.
taxonomy_name: Transitional Residential Substance Use Disorder Services
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
nameLevel3: Transitional Residential Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call for phone assessment or to schedule an in-person assessment.
site_eligibility: Men -- Age 18 or older -- Recovering from alcohol or drug addiction -- Completed detox or not needing medical care -- Employed or actively seeking employment (arrangements can be made for those who are unable to find work due to disability)

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization offering residential substance abuse recovery and transitional housing to men and women.
service_description: Provides transitional housing for men and women recovering from alcohol or drug addiction. Residents must attend 12-step recovery meetings; four per week, and adhere to house rules. Support services include life-skills classes and referrals to social services.
taxonomy_name: Transitional Residential Substance Use Disorder Services
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
nameLevel3: Transitional Residential Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call to schedule an intake assessment.
site_eligibility: Men and women without children -- With income (such as employment or SSI/SSD)

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization offering residential substance abuse recovery and transitional housing to men and women.
service_description: Offers an intensive, structured, two-year supportive housing program for homeless persons with substance abuse issues. Clients participate in workshops and receive individualized case management to assist them in achieving self-sufficiency.
taxonomy_name: Residential Substance Use Disorder Treatment Facilities
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
nameLevel4: Residential Substance Use Disorder Treatment Facilities
site_details: Call to schedule an intake assessment.
site_eligibility: With substance abuse issues -- Not in need of medical detoxification -- Able to perform, without assistance, all of the activities of daily living

agency_desc: A government agency that administers housing assistance programs.
service_description: Serves as an application and recertification site for the Section 8 Housing Choice Voucher program in the city of Elwood. Housing Choice Vouchers help eligible households pay the rent on privately owned homes of their choosing (property owners must agree to program participation). Call to confirm if wait list is open or closed. People already on the wait list must keep their contact information current to remain on the list.
site_details: Call to check if wait list is open or closed. -- Those already on the wait list should call to update contact information as needed.
site_eligibility: When the list is open, income guidelines will be posted. Preference given to Elwood residents, seniors, and persons with disabilities.

agency_desc: A career center providing adult basic education and high school equivalency testing.
service_description: Serves as an official testing center for Indiana's high school equivalency test, which enables people who did not complete high school to earn a high school equivalency diploma. Testing at this location takes place monthly and is available in computer format (unless paper and pencil are specifically requested in advance).
site_details: Call or walk in for testing schedule or to register for an appointment.
site_eligibility: Have lived in Indiana for at least 30 days -- Age 18 or older (recommended); ages 16-17 may be eligible to take the test  with a letter of recommendation signed by a superintendent of an Indiana public school system -- Not enrolled in high school

agency_desc: Provides emergency fire and medical services.
service_description: Responds to fire, emergency medical, hazardous material, and special rescue situations in the city of Anderson in Madison County. Nonemergency services include fire prevention education and public awareness. Persons in need of emergency services should call 9-1-1.
site_details: Call 9-1-1 for emergency assistance. For nonemergency services, call the office during business hours.
site_eligibility: Open; responds to emergency situations in the city of Anderson

agency_desc: Provides emergency fire and medical services.
service_description: Responds to fire, emergency medical, hazardous material, and special rescue situations in the city of Anderson in Madison County. Nonemergency services include fire prevention education and public awareness. Persons in need of emergency services should call 9-1-1.

agency_desc: Provides emergency fire and medical services.
service_description: Provides free smoke alarms to households in need, when funds are available.
site_details: Walk in or call for information.
site_eligibility: Living in Anderson

agency_desc: Serves as the state trial court for the county, hearing both civil and criminal cases.
service_description: Oversees both criminal and civil trials, including juvenile and family cases, in Madison County.
site_details: Varies; cases are generally initiated through the prosecutor's office, private attorneys -- individuals representing themselves. For general information, contact the Court Administrator. For juror information, contact the Jury Administrator.
site_eligibility: Persons named in cases or called for jury duty at this court

agency_desc: Serves as the state trial court for the county, hearing both civil and criminal cases.
service_description: Provides probation services for the Madison County Circuit Courts, including supervising adult offenders in the community and linking them with programs and services to support their rehabilitation.
site_details: Through the courts; call for information.
site_eligibility: Offenders assigned to probation by the Madison County Courts

agency_desc: Serves as the state trial court for the county, hearing both civil and criminal cases.
service_description: Handles civil lawsuits for $6,000 or less, including contracts, collection of rent, evictions, and personal loans. Only corporations are required to be represented by an attorney and only on claims over $1,500. In Madison County, Circuit Court 5 handles small claims cases.
site_details: Walk in or visit the website for claim forms.
site_eligibility: To file a lawsuit: Age 18 or older -- With a civil claim for less than $6,000 -- Meeting one of the following three requirements: Person being sued lives or works in Madison County -- Matter resulting in lawsuit took place in Madison County -- Matter resulting in lawsuit was to be performed

agency_desc: Serves as the state trial court for the county, hearing both civil and criminal cases.
service_description: Provides probation services for the Madison County Circuit Courts, including supervising juvenile offenders in the community and linking them with programs and services to support their rehabilitation.
site_details: Through the courts; call for information.
site_eligibility: Offenders assigned to probation by the Madison County Courts

agency_desc: Serves as the state trial court for the county, hearing both civil and criminal cases.
service_description: Oversees court cases involving Madison County minors, including petitions for emancipation, children in need of services (CHINS), and minors accused of delinquency or status offenses.
site_details: By court order; parents cannot self-refer children to juvenile court
site_eligibility: Madison County juveniles age 17 or younger

agency_desc: Serves as the state trial court for the county, hearing both civil and criminal cases.
service_description: Maintains a county correctional facility for juveniles. Detention is for the purpose of ensuring the safety of the child or the community and to ensure that the accused appears at hearings. Detainees receive physical exams, counseling, education, and recreation.
site_details: For general information or to schedule a visit, call the detention unit.
site_eligibility: Age 12-18 years-old -- Detained by court order or awaiting hearing

agency_desc: Provides maintenance services on public roads and streets.
service_description: Maintains county roadways in Madison County, including patching, paving, snow removal, street sweeping, roadside mowing, and drainage along roadways. Offers empty bags to be filled with sand to prevent flood damage.
site_details: Call for information or to report a problem. Call ahead for availability of empty bags. To report urgent problems after hours, call 9-1-1 or Madison County dispatch.
site_eligibility: Open (limited to county roads and properties in Madison County)

agency_name: EAST CENTRAL INDIANA SOLID WASTE DISTRICT
agency_desc: A government agency that provides hazardous material management and recycling services.
site_name: EAST CENTRAL INDIANA SOLID WASTE DISTRICT - MADISON COUNTY RECYCLING CENTER
service_description: Accepts hazardous waste materials from Madison County households for proper disposal. Acceptable items include oil-based paints, rechargeable and vehicle batteries, electronics, flammable liquids and solids, acids, poisons, car and light truck tires.
site_details: Drop off items during specified hours. -- Call or visit the website for information.
site_schedule: Tues and Thurs 8am-4pm; Wed 10am-6pm; monthly 2nd and 4th Sat 8am-noon
site_eligibility: Madison County households (no businesses)

agency_desc: A pubic library that offers a diverse collection for adults and children consisting of books, movies, music CDs, audiobooks, magazines, and local newspapers. agency_desc: A public library that provides access to library materials and services for patrons of all ages. Food pantry is also available to those in need.
service_description: Provides nonperishable and limited perishable food to those in need. Limited service area.
site_details: Walk in.
site_eligibility: Living in Fall Creek, Green, or Adams Township

agency_desc: County veterans service officers are veterans employed by the county to act as liaisons with county residents for veteran issues, including but not limited to; providing forms, information, and assistance in obtaining state and federal veterans benefits.
service_description: Provides information about and assistance with veterans' benefits to veterans, their surviving spouses, and their children. County service officers can assist in the completion and submission of forms necessary to receive all appropriate federal and state veterans' benefits.
site_details: Call or email to request an appointment; walk-ins are also accepted -- DURING COVID-19 by appointment only
site_eligibility: Veteran, surviving spouses or children of a veteran

agency_desc: A nonprofit agency providing social and recreational programs for persons living in the city of Alexandria and surrounding towns in Madison County.

agency_desc: Oversees all voter registration and maintains voter filings.
service_description: Oversees the administration of all county-level elections, candidate filings, and campaign finance in the county. This office and website also serves as a voter registration site and provides information about candidates, voting times and locations, absentee voting, and working the polls.
site_details: To register to vote, walk in or register online. Voter registration also available at the public library, clerk's office, or at the BMV. -- For election information, call this office or visit the website.
site_eligibility: To register to vote in this county: United States citizens -- Living in this county -- At least 18 years-old on the day of the next election -- Not currently imprisoned after being convicted of a crime -- To vote in in this county: Registered in current precinct at least 29 days before the election

agency_desc: A community college offering certifications and associate degrees.

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that provides faith-based, support services to men currently incarcerated or recently released from a correctional facility.
service_description: Offers faith-based support services and guidance to men currently incarcerated or released from a correctional facility to transition to community life. Group meetings cover topics including personal growth, leadership, substance abuse recovery, and lifestyle (being a good father/husband). Program participants may also receive job search assistance after establishing participation and attendance to at least 7 meetings.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call for more information
site_eligibility: Men -- Age 18 or older -- Ex-offenders

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that offers services for the community.
service_description: Provides an evidence-based program for families with youth ages 10-14 to develop a positive living environment and enhance family relationships. The program includes family activities that improve communication, effective discipline techniques, and dealing with stress and peer pressure. Meals are shared with the families during meetings. Childcare is provided during the meeting for children 9 and younger.
site_details: Call or visit the website to register.
site_eligibility: Living in Madison County -- Parents or caregivers with youth ages 10-14 -- Able to commit to full session

agency_desc: Provides law enforcement services for the state of Indiana.
service_description: Conducts state law enforcement and criminal investigations and enforces traffic laws on state highways and interstate expressways. This agency also provides technical and other special assistance to local and federal law enforcement agencies and conducts research and planning regarding law enforcement services in Indiana. This district office serves Elkhart, Kosciusko, Marshall, and St Joseph County.
site_details: Call or visit the website for information or nonemergency assistance. For emergency police assistance, call 9-1-1.
site_eligibility: Varies by service; this district office serves Delaware, Fayette, Henry, Madison, Randolph, Rush, Union, and Wayne County.

agency_name: CLEAN SLATE MEDICAL GROUP OF INDIANA
agency_desc: A commercial business that provides outpatient treatment for substance addiction, primarily alcohol and opioid use disorders.
service_description: Provides an outpatient medically-assisted treatment program for adults who are addicted to alcohol and/or opioid drugs. Medications provided may include buprenorphine (Suboxone) or naltrexone (Vivitrol).
taxonomy_name: Medication Assisted Maintenance Treatment for Substance Use Disorders
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
nameLevel4: Medication Assisted Maintenance Treatment for Substance Use Disorders
site_details: Call for appointment or more information.
site_eligibility: Addicted to alcohol or opioid drugs

agency_desc: A faith-based organization with a mission "to provide compassionate Rescue services on an immediate and/or long-term basis to the poor and needy of Muncie and East Central Indiana."
site_name: MUNCIE MISSION MINISTRIES - WOMEN'S TRANSITIONAL HOME - ALEXANDRIA
service_description: Provides transitional housing for low-income women who are homeless. This is not an emergency shelter and admission takes 7-14 days to complete. Supportive services, including case management and self-help classes, are available. Residents are required to attend a place of worship of their choice. Typical length of stay is 6-18 months.
site_details: Call or visit website www.munciemission.org/womens-services to download application. -- Complete application and submit by mail, e-mail, or in person. -- Participate in an interview process and take a drug test at director's discretion.
site_eligibility: Women -- Age 18 or older -- Employable -- With or without children -- No male children over age 11 -- Willing to participate in all classes, off-site services, and community service weekly -- Willing to continue current services provided by other agencies -- 30 days clean from drug and alcohol use/abuse and actively pursuing recovery

service_description: Provides counseling to individuals, couples, and families struggling with depression, anxiety, stress, relationship problems, and other intellectual and mental health issues. Level of care is based on assessment. Sliding scale fees are available for income-eligible clients.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call to schedule an assessment.
site_schedule: Mon, Tues, Thurs, and Fri 8am-5pm; Wed 8am-8pm
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A nonprofit healthcare organization that provides a range of physical and mental health services.
site_name: MERIDIAN HEALTH SERVICES AND DENTAL CARE - ANDERSON
service_description: Offers affordable primary health care for uninsured and underinsured clients. Services include family practice, pediatrics, prenatal and obstetric care, women's health services, laboratory testing, radiology, immunizations, diabetes treatment, weight management, smoking cessation, sports physicals, and well child exams.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment or walk in during office hours.
site_schedule: Mon, Tues, Thurs, and Fri 8am-5pm; Wed 8am-8pm
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A nonprofit healthcare organization that provides a range of physical and mental health services.
site_name: MERIDIAN HEALTH SERVICES AND DENTAL CARE - ANDERSON
service_description: Provides preventive dental services and treatment including extractions, fillings, and limited crowns on a sliding-scale basis for low-income patients.
site_details: Call to request an appointment. Same day visits can sometimes be arranged for patients experiencing dental pain. (New patients must complete forms and undergo a comprehensive exam.)
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A noncommercial, Federally Qualified Health Center that acts as the safety net for the uninsured and under-insured of East Central Indiana.
service_description: Provides primary health care to patients of all ages. Services include annual exams, well child checks, lab testing, medication management, and physicals for work, school, or sports. Health screening is available for blood pressure, diabetes, and cholesterol/triglycerides. Additional services, such as mental health counseling or diet and nutrition support, may also be offered to established clients.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment.
site_schedule: Mon and Wed 8am-6pm; Tues, Thurs, and Fri 8am-5pm; by appointment only
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A faith-based, nonprofit agency providing resources for those experiencing an unplanned pregnancy.
service_description: Provides free baby supplies to those in need. Selections vary based on donations, but diapers, canned formula, baby food, and baby cereal are generally available. Limit one visit per month.
site_details: Walk in or call the Care Line to request emergency assistance.
site_schedule: Mon, Wed, and Fri noon-5pm; Tues and Thurs noon-7pm -- Care Line: Daily 24 hours
site_eligibility: Not received diapers or food from this agency within the last month

agency_desc: A faith-based, nonprofit agency providing resources for those experiencing an unplanned pregnancy.
service_description: Offers advocate counseling and information about pregnancy options; however, does not offer abortion services or abortion referrals.  Free, confidential pregnancy testing and confirmation is also available; including ultra-sound testing by appointment.
site_details: Walk in during office hours, or call the Care Line for emergency assistance.
site_schedule: Office: Mon, Wed, and Fri noon-5pm; Tues and Thurs noon-7pm -- Care Line: Daily 24 hours
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A faith-based, nonprofit agency providing resources for those experiencing an unplanned pregnancy.
service_description: Provides one-on-one parenting education and mentorship for people who are pregnant or are parenting a child under the age of 4. Through weekly sessions and assignments, participants earn "Baby Bucks," which can be redeemed for donated baby supplies (such as maternity and infant clothing, and new cribs).
site_details: Call or walk in to schedule an intake appointment.
site_schedule: Office: Mon, Wed, and Fri noon-5pm; Tues and Thurs noon-7pm -- Parenting Education: By appointment
site_eligibility: Expectant parent -OR- Parent/Guardian of a child 4 or younger
